item.title: Articles
item.description: .card_wrapper { box-shadow: 5px 5px 3px grey; border-width: 1px; border-color: grey; border-style: solid; margin-bottom: 30px; padding: 2%; } .publisher_title { color: #464646; letter-spacing: .2px; font-family: Oxygen,Arial,Helvetica Neue,Helvetica,sans-serif; font-weight: 700; margin: -1% 0% 1% 0%; } .article_title { margin: 1% 0% 0% 0%; } .article_image { width:80%; height: 370px; display: block; margin: auto; object-fit: cover; } .article_desc { margin: 1% 0% 0% 0%; } University of Southampton Turing at Southampton Welcomes New Fellows (16 Jan 2019) Representatives from The Alan Turing Institute at Southampton welcomed a new cohort of fellows and a doctoral student to the Turing at Southampton group.

item.title: About
item.description: Joseph is a doctoral student with the University of Southampton and the Alan Turing Institute. He completed an undergraduate degree in computer science at the University of Southampton, and then specialised with a master’s degree focused on machine learning (also at the University of Southampton). Joseph pursed his interest in machine learning and is now researching explainable artificial intelligence – the process of unpacking the “black box” of machine learning and understanding why models exhibit certain behaviours.
